page.title: 13Employment in the Area.
page.content: Our D-block is not a very heavily populated area. Some people who live in the villages work on local farms and in shops but many more have to travel for their work. The town of Abingdon provides jobs in such places as Local Government Authorities, Health Services and in light industry on small industrial estates. Other people work further afield in places such as the British Leyland car factory at Cowley, near Oxford, the blanket factory in Witney, the Atomic Energy Research Establishment at Harwell, the J.E.T. project at Culham and the Rutherford laboratories. Many people commute via Didcot and Oxford railway stations to work in either Reading or London. We are lucky in this part of South Oxon as unemployment is low. Work is available for those who wish it.
